MCUCTRL - MCU Control
mcu » apollo330P

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides functions for interfacing with the MCU Control (MCUCTRL) module on Apollo5 devices. It supports device information retrieval, external clock control, status monitoring, and chip configuration for system management and initialization.

Key Features

  1. Device Information: Retrieve chip ID, revision, and vendor information.
  2. Memory Configuration: Access memory size and configuration data.
  3. External Clock: Manage external clock status and configuration.
  4. System Control: Provide system control and status operations.
  5. Feature Detection: Identify device features and capabilities.

Functionality

  • Retrieve device information and chip identification
  • Access memory configuration and size information
  • Manage external clock status and configuration
  • Provide system control and status operations
  • Support for device feature detection and configuration

Usage

  1. Get device information using am_hal_mcuctrl_info_get()
  2. Retrieve memory configuration as needed
  3. Check external clock status
  4. Access system control functions
  5. Query device features and capabilities

Configuration

  • Device Info: Access chip ID, revision, and vendor data
  • Memory Sizes: Retrieve ITCM, DTCM, and SSRAM configurations
  • External Clocks: Configure external clock sources
  • System Control: Set up system control operations

◆ APOLLO330P_A0

#define APOLLO330P_A0
Value:
((MCUCTRL->CHIPREV & \
(MCUCTRL_CHIPREV_REVMAJ_Msk | MCUCTRL_CHIPREV_REVMIN_Msk)) == \
(_VAL2FLD(MCUCTRL_CHIPREV_REVMAJ, MCUCTRL_CHIPREV_REVMAJ_A) | \
_VAL2FLD(MCUCTRL_CHIPREV_REVMIN, MCUCTRL_CHIPREV_REVMIN_REV0)))

◆ APOLLO330P_A0_GE_TRIMVER1

#define APOLLO330P_A0_GE_TRIMVER1   (APOLLO330P_A0 && (g_ui32TrimVer >= A0_TRIMVER_1))

◆ APOLLO330P_A0_GE_TRIMVER2

#define APOLLO330P_A0_GE_TRIMVER2   (APOLLO330P_A0 && (g_ui32TrimVer >= A0_TRIMVER_2))

◆ APOLLO330P_A0_LE_TRIMVER1

#define APOLLO330P_GE_A0
Value:
((MCUCTRL->CHIPREV & \
(MCUCTRL_CHIPREV_REVMAJ_Msk | MCUCTRL_CHIPREV_REVMIN_Msk)) >= \
(_VAL2FLD(MCUCTRL_CHIPREV_REVMAJ, MCUCTRL_CHIPREV_REVMAJ_A) | \
_VAL2FLD(MCUCTRL_CHIPREV_REVMIN, MCUCTRL_CHIPREV_REVMIN_REV0)))

◆ APOLLO330P_GT_A0

#define APOLLO330P_GT_A0
Value:
((MCUCTRL->CHIPREV & \
(MCUCTRL_CHIPREV_REVMAJ_Msk | MCUCTRL_CHIPREV_REVMIN_Msk)) > \
(_VAL2FLD(MCUCTRL_CHIPREV_REVMAJ, MCUCTRL_CHIPREV_REVMAJ_A) | \
_VAL2FLD(MCUCTRL_CHIPREV_REVMIN, MCUCTRL_CHIPREV_REVMIN_REV0)))

Function Documentation

◆ am_hal_mcuctrl_clkncnt_get()

uint32_t am_hal_mcuctrl_clkncnt_get ( void )

Get the count of Radio CLKN Counter.

Returns
- the count of Radio CLKN Counter with 312.5us precision

◆ am_hal_mcuctrl_control()

uint32_t am_hal_mcuctrl_control ( am_hal_mcuctrl_control_e eControl,
void * pArgs )

Apply various specific commands/controls on the MCUCTRL module.

This function is used to apply various controls to MCUCTRL.

Parameters
eControl- One of the following: AM_HAL_MCUCTRL_CONTROL_EXTCLK32K_ENABLE AM_HAL_MCUCTRL_CONTROL_EXTCLK32K_DISABLE AM_HAL_MCUCTRL_CONTROL_EXTCLK48M_KICK_START AM_HAL_MCUCTRL_CONTROL_EXTCLK48M_NORMAL AM_HAL_MCUCTRL_CONTROL_EXTCLK48M_DISABLE
pArgs- Pointer to arguments for Control Switch Case
Returns
status - generic or interface specific status.

◆ am_hal_mcuctrl_extclk32k_status_get()

uint32_t am_hal_mcuctrl_extclk32k_status_get ( am_hal_mcuctrl_ext32k_status_e * peStatus)

Get current status of EXTCLK32K.

Parameters
peStatus- pointer to enum variable for query result. It will be written to one of the followings:
  • AM_HAL_MCUCTRL_EXT32K_STATUS_OFF: EXTCLK32K not enabled by SW
  • AM_HAL_MCUCTRL_EXT32K_STATUS_XTAL: EXTCLK32K enabled in XTAL Mode by SW
  • AM_HAL_MCUCTRL_EXT32K_STATUS_EXT_CLK: EXTCLK32K enabled in EXT_CLK mode by SW
Returns
status - generic or interface specific status.

◆ am_hal_mcuctrl_finecnt_get()

uint32_t am_hal_mcuctrl_finecnt_get ( void )

Get the count of Radio Fine Counter.

Returns
- the count of Radio Fine Counter with 0.5us precision

◆ am_hal_mcuctrl_i3c_phy_pulldown_enable()

void am_hal_mcuctrl_i3c_phy_pulldown_enable ( bool bEnable)

I3C PHY pull down switch.

Parameters
bEnable- TRUE: Enable I3C PHY pull down. FALSE: Disable I3C PHY pull down.

◆ am_hal_mcuctrl_info_get()

uint32_t am_hal_mcuctrl_info_get ( am_hal_mcuctrl_infoget_e eInfoGet,
void * pInfo )

Get information of the given MCUCTRL item.

This function returns a data structure of information regarding the given MCUCTRL parameter.

Parameters
eInfoGet- One of the following: Return structure type: AM_HAL_MCUCTRL_INFO_DEVICEID, psDevice AM_HAL_MCUCTRL_INFO_FAULT_STATUS psFault
pInfo- A pointer to a structure to receive the return data, the type of which is dependent on the eInfo parameter.
Returns
status - generic or interface specific status.
Note
IMPORTANT - This function requires access to INFO0 and/or INFO1 data. Therefore, if either INFO0 or INFO1 is in OTP, OTP must be powered up prior to calling this function. For more information, see the description for am_hal_info0_read().

◆ am_hal_mcuctrl_rss_codebase_set()

uint32_t am_hal_mcuctrl_rss_codebase_set ( uint32_t ui32Codebase_addr)

Set Radio subsystem code base address.

Parameters
ui32Codebase_addr- Radio subsystem code base address from 0x400000 to 0x5FFFFF(2MB),16Bytes align
Returns
status - generic or interface specific status.

◆ am_hal_mcuctrl_status_get()

uint32_t am_hal_mcuctrl_status_get ( am_hal_mcuctrl_status_t * psStatus)

MCUCTRL status function.

This function returns current status of the MCUCTRL as obtained from various registers of the MCUCTRL block.

Parameters
psStatus- ptr to a status structure to receive the current statuses.
Returns
status - generic or interface specific status.

◆ am_hal_mcuctrl_usb_phy_ldo0p9_enable()

void am_hal_mcuctrl_usb_phy_ldo0p9_enable ( bool bEnable)

USB PHY LDO (0.9V) Switch Control.

Parameters
bEnable- TRUE: Enable USB PHY LDO (0.9V) power-on FALSE: Disable USB PHY LDO (0.9V) power-off.
